intro: Viola media, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers cool, moist environments with partial shade. Its flowers have five petals, with the upper petal often bearing a distinctive spur. Viola media is native to Europe and has been widely cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
